content: pprrooppeerr ttrraappppiinnggss original designs not so tiny top green butterflies continue in filet mesh over 10 mesh squares for another 9 row you will now begin the neckline shaping place a this vest is made in a soft rayon yarn it is very loose marker at the front edge before starting row 31 and airy done in filet mesh with a large gauge the vest is row 31 ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet in next double_crochet crocheted all in one piece starting at the bottom until it is continue in filet mesh to end of row turn split for the armholes the only seams are at the shoulders row 32 continue in filet mesh until one mesh square the few row forming the sleeves are crocheted out of the remains skip 2 chain and treble_crochet in last double_crochet turn armholes the whole project is then given a shell edging row 33 repeat row 31 difficulty easy to intermediate depending on whether you row 34 repeat row 32 include the butterflies row 35 repeat row 31 size since the top is loose fitting and flyaway it will fit a row 36 continuing in filet mesh do 5 mesh squares lot of medium-large sized people you can also adjust it repeat row 36 two more times fasten_off some with the ribbon the directions below will give a top that will fit a 36 to 40 bust you can make it longer by left front doing more row of open filet mesh before you begin the this front is worked from the armhole edge to the front edge butterflies it is identical to the right front but with all shaping reversed gauge approximately 6 squares across and 6 squares with the right side facing you attach your yarn to the double down over a 4 by 4 10 cm by 10 cm swatch of filet crochet that is 11 squares from the left front edge mesh this translates into 19 stitches and 6 row row 21 ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet in next double_crochet continue in filet mesh to end 10 mesh squares turn main part of garment continue in filet mesh over 10 mesh squares for another 9 the written instructions below are for making the vest row you will now begin the neckline shaping again place without any butterflies using only open squares of filet mesh a marker at the front edge before starting row 31 additional instructions and a chart for including the butterflies are below even if you do not plan to include butterflies you row 31 continue in filet mesh until one mesh square may find the chart helpful for understanding the shaping remains skip 2 chain and treble_crochet in last double_crochet turn row 32 ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet in next double_crochet bottom of garment continue in filet mesh to end of row turn ch148 and turn begin filet mesh pattern stitch over 49 mesh row 33 repeat
